f.lux Makes Your Computer Screen Bearable

Feb 28, 2014
1 minute read

Like most geeks, I tend to stay on my computer way too late at night. Even though I’ve read too many studies about computer use at night, I can’t seem to help myself.

Tonight, my wife turned me onto an app that I’ve needed for years: f.lux. By the app’s own description:

Ever notice how people texting at night have that eerie blue glow?

Or wake up ready to write down the Next Great Idea, and get blinded by your computer screen?

During the day, computer screens look good—they’re designed to look like the sun. But, at 9PM, 10PM, or 3AM, you probably shouldn’t be looking at the sun.

f.lux fixes this: it makes the color of your computer’s display adapt to the time of day, warm at night and like sunlight during the day.

It’s an amazingly easy process: simply choose a color scheme and brightness for “daytime” and “at night” and let the app do the work. As day turns into night, f.lux takes care of it.

Even after just an hour of use, my eyes already feel better – I don’t feel like I’m “looking at the sun.” I’ll be curious to see if this improves my sleep habits at night (although, I suppose the cure-all would be to shut this thing off at a reasonable hour…but that sounds awfully difficult).
